chapter.title: Tools and Administration
chapter.para: On the right side of the menu bar, next to the menu Sensors we find the “tools” section or Tools where you can find the options for the configuration of the redBorder platform.

caption.para: Tools: available options for configuring the redBorder platform

chapter.para: From this menu you can establish the conditions to be met so that the user is notified by an alarm, track the activities of the users of the platform, to register new users or to manage cluster configuration, sensors and servers, among other actions.
These are the options found in the tool menu:

listitem.para: Alarms: establishing the conditions for activating a user notification.
Audits: allows tracking of user activity using log.
Cluster Settings: shows us the settings that have been established for the cluster in the Manager installation process.
General Settings: the user can establish the general parameter settings of the Manager, as well as the Apps they have registered.
Correlation Engine Rules: provides the list of the cep rules. Here we can also check the existing rules and create new ones.
Monitor Categories: shows the current categories being used from snmp and allows the creation of new ones.
Licenses: list of the licenses under those that operate the different modules of the redBorder platform.
Lookup Sources: list of URLs of web services of network data consultation.
Objects: network objects defined in the redBorder platform.
Overlay Maps: images that can be superimposed on a map with the latitude and longitude indicated.
Platform Alerts: shows the current platform alert to every user.
Rule Versions: list of the licenses under those that operate the different modules of the redBorder platform.
Support Center: direct access to support center. It is necessary to be registered in support page.
Users: profile management and user permissions.
Worker and Job Queue: show the current active and stored workers and jobs on Redborder manager.

section.title: Alarms
section.para: An alarm is a notification that is triggered when one or more conditions are met by the user.
By accessing this option the list of alarms that have been registered are displayed.

section.title: Create new alarm
section.para: By clicking on the button +New Alarm we access the form, in which the conditions will be established that the alarm must meet to activate a notification, and the degree of severity defined for that alarm.
This form consists of three sections:

listitem.para: General settings
Notifications
Conditions

section.para: In this section, the user must complete the following data:

listitem.para: Name: alarm name.
Time window: time interval that must be overcome by excess or default values given in upper/bottom limit so that the alarm is active.
Notify every: set time sequence for notification.
Upper/ Bottom limits: indicates the number of events (maximum/minimum) that must meet the conditions of the alarm to activate the notification.

Product type: select the type of App/item for which the alarm has defined.
The user will see in this field options that are included in their license.
-Traffic
-Intrussion
-Monitor
-Social
-Vault

Severity: the user must define the severity level that's given to the alarm. Depending on the conditions you have defined for the alarm will imply a very low risk, low, medium, high, very high or critical. This gradation of severity is also indicated on a color scale.

section.para: In this section, the user will select the means by which the alarm is notified and will introduce the data for the method chosen. Activate the check option you want for the notification:

listitem.para: Notify to Syslog: check that to export the notifications to an external syslog server.
Notify to email: check that to receive an email when a alarm is raised.

section.title: Audits
section.para: Option AuditsThis option shows a list of the recorded user activity in the redBorder platform, chronologically ordered, by default.. However, the user can sort the table in an ascending or descending way for each of the columns. You can use the search box located on the top to filter the information you want to see. The columns displayed in this table are the following:

listitem.para: User: user that did the action
Resource: item that has been created, modified, or deleted.
Action: action that has been carried out (creating, editing, deleting).
Message: brief description of what has been audited.
Timestamp: date and time of the activity record.

section.title: Cluster Settings
section.para: Option Cluster Settings allows us to check the status and cluster settings, set the cluster creation process during the Manager installation process.
You can modify these values by editing through the unlock button Unlock. The information can be changed with the following parameters:

listitem.para: Cluster Status
Virtual IP Addresses
Historical Nodes
Historical Rules

caption.para: Cluster Settings: status and cluster settings

section.title: General settings
section.para: Option General Settings shows us an interface whose editing will be determined for both the platform configuration, as well as the network infrastructure, as it was explained in the chapter about sensors.

caption.para: General Settings: general settings for redBorder Manager

note.title: Note
note.para: To view all sections, it's advised to enable the option Show advanced options located on the top right of the screen in general settings.

In this screen you can edit the parameters of both the Manager and the Apps that have been registered. Therefore, the sections displayed will depend on the Apps that are integrated into the redBorder platform.

section.para: To perform a basic configuration in Manager, the user can edit general parameters, characteristics of the Apps, server configuration, network, routes and geolocation of the IPs.
In this section the user can change the following elements:

listitem.para: Company name: Name of the company using Redborder
Company email: Company email. Will be used as the report sender and license management
Web URL: Interface URL
Autoreload dashboard time: Refresh period for the dashboards (seconds)
Autoreload raw time: Refresh period for the interface (seconds)
Rule Update Job Periodicity: Periodicity for updating the Rules
Rule Update Job Time UTC time when the Rule Update Job will be executed

important.title: Important
important.para: All parameters defined in this interface are inherited by those elements that are found on lower levels in a dependent state (domains, sensors). To modify this information, the user must write or edit it, as described in the chapter about editing sensors and configuration Sensors.

section.para: Here we can set in Redborder the IPS/IDS physical setup and configuration.
Allows to set a SSL certificate for secure communications.
Configuration of servers Syslog, MTA, NTP and enable proxy settings.

note.title: Note
note.para: An example of how to configure servers is in Chapter 11, “Editing sensor and/or domain."

section.para: Configuration of Default Rules for loading or dropping data.
This section helps you to momitorize redBorder infrastructure. In the field Syslog Servers you have to indicate in which remote server, logs are going to be sent.
You must select which protocol and which Syslog mode you want to use for the sendings.

note.title: Note
note.para: TCP protocol is recommended in order to guarantee a safe sending. Choose this option whenever possible.

section.para: The section New Relic allows you to report to New Relic cloud. In this case, the user have to indicate the number of their New Relic License and if they have a Cluster group, write its name.
The activation of Enable Plugins check is optional because this is a payment service. Activate Enable APM in case of web monitoring.
If user wants to send their logs to this Amazon Service, required fields must be filled.
Is possible to link Redborder with Google Maps API to get better location information.
It enables a backup of user's data in a remote server or database. For this, it is necessary to indicate Hostname, Bucket, and Access and Secret key.
In this section the networks are indicated whose traffic will pass without package inspection, because the networks are considered “reliable.”
Add a new network: click the button +Add and indicate the network IP.
Delete a network from the list: through the icon “Delete".

caption.para: General settings: Add a new White Network

section.para: List of networks whose traffic should be blocked because of the bad reputation.
Add a new network: just click on the button +Add and indicate the network IP.
Delete a network from the list: through the icon “Delete".

caption.para: General settings: Add a new Black Network

section.para: In this section the user will define the network routes for Manager.
Add a new network: click on the button +Add and indicate the network IP route.
Delete a network from the list: through the icon “Delete”.

caption.para: General settings: list of Network Routes

section.para: In this section the user will define the network routes for Manager.
Add a new network: click on the button +Add and indicate the network IP route.
Delete a network from the list: through the icon “Delete”.

caption.para: General settings: list of Network Routes

section.para: To enable Geo Protection function it is necessary to have an updated geolocalization database in order to avoid errors in IPs geolocalization. redBorder has been configured to support only Maxmind database format.
These are the types of databases that are admitted for IPv4 and IPv6 versions (binary format of old GeoIp):

listitem.para: Country: it determines the country of an Internet visitor based on their IP Address.
City: it indicates the country, subdivisions, city, postcode, latitude and longitude associated with IPv4 and IPv6 worldwide addresses.
ASN: GeoIP2 database of anonymous IP contains data about IP addresses of the networks that have been used in a various ways by anonymous.

section.para: Download all the files from Maxmind website and unzip them. It is only possible to upload files with .dat format as we can see in the image below. For this, click on +Select File

In this section, the user can select from the web interface the different extra steps for data enrichment in logstash (available for the Traffic, Intrusion and Mobility module). Disabling these options would improve resource management and overall performance, but would lose the functionality described below. It is recommended to keep them active.

listitem.para: MAC Scrambling: It allows to protect the sensor MAC, for this a hexadecimal encoded key is used that is combined with a fake MAC. This in turn allows obtaining the real MAC of the sensor and providing security so as not to compromise the service provided.
Geo IP: Allows to enable Geo Protection to discover information regarding the geographical position of a specific IP address.
MAC Vendor: The MAC translation process included in the event allow to obtain the name of the device manufacturer. This process is compared in a file stored within the system.

Darklist: It is a service that is responsible for retrieving a list of malicious IPs and storing multiple values as score, type, country, laditude, longitude... in the system in order to perform modification operations on the event fields. The files are refreshes every day.

section.title: Correlation Engine Rules
section.para: Here the use can see all the rules for the correlation engine. It is possible to edit the existing rules and also create new ones.

section.title: Monitor Categories
section.para: Here we can add a new category to monitorize the hardware. The categories use technologies such as SNMP, Redfish or IPMI to provide information about the system and its functioning.
To add a new monitor category we must use the top right button. Then we will fill the fields selecting the correct technology allowing Redborder to receive the data.

section.title: Malware Settings
section.para: All the sensors and services that make up the redborder Malware solution can be configured at the root level (root) from the section Tools -> Malware Settings.

warning.title: Warning
warning.para: The configuration of the Mail Gateway sensors that is made from this interface will be applied automatically to all the elements that are below, so if you want to make a more specific configuration, the user must overwrite this information by accessing the corresponding sensor in Sensors and selecting the "Edit" option in the menu displayed by the "Edit" icon.

caption.para: Specific configuration of Mail Gateway sensors

section.para: The Malware Settings interface is made up of five sections:

listitem.para: General
Loaders
Mail Gateway
Blacklist
Whitelist

section.title: General
section.para:
En este apartado se indica el valor o "score" a partir del cual un fichero es considerado Malware. Este valor aplicará sobre todos los sensores siempre y cuando estos no tengan una Filter Policy configurada previamente
En caso de que se hayan creado Filter Policies, el score será determinado del siguiente modo: Filter Policies -> Editar política -> Threshold Configuration -> Score to consider element as Malware..

Se trata de un valor que es definido por el usuario para indicar el riesgo mayor o menos de intrusión o peligro: a menor score, menor probabilidad de Malware, a mayor score, mayor probabilidad de Malware. Este valor debe ser positivo para que sea considerado un score válido.

caption.para: Malware Settings: Global Malware score threshold

note.title: Nota
note.para: Los valores válidos para el score son los siguientes:
Malware: cualquier valor igual o mayor que el definido por el usuario.

section.title: Loaders
section.para: Loaders section is made up of two subsections:

listitem.para: Loaders
API Keys

section.para: This subsection defines the weight given to each loader so that the platform can carry out a weighting between all the loaders to obtain the total score.
The main objective of this subsection is for each user to optimize the values indicated here according to their needs.
Each component has a series of associated loaders whose weight can be defined in each of the displayed tabs: Hash, URL and IP.
The analyzers are divided into three sections depending on the time required for the analysis:

listitem.para: Realtime.
Fast Batch processing.
Slow Batch processing.

section.para: In this section the user must enter the keys that have been provided by the providers for the activation of the loaders.

section.title: Mail Gateway
section.para: In this section the user can make the general configuration of the Mail Gateway sensors. To make a specific configuration in any of the sensors, you must overwrite this information in Sensors (sensores Mail Gateway -> Edit).

The user can define the values that will be taken as a reference to regulate the behavior of the Mail Gateway sensors for the identification of the risk of intrusion and/or the danger of Malware propagation.
This section is divided into two subsections:

listitem.para: Relay Domain
Default Values

section.para: In this section, you must indicate which domain will be managed by the Mail Gateway sensors by default. In order for this value to be saved, the configuration must be updated using Update settings.
The user can indicate a series of default values that will be related to the behavior of the sensors for Malware detection:

listitem.para: Relay Host: Specify the IP of the final mail server.
Message Size Limit: Define the maximum size of messages that can be received.
Max Paralell Process: Indicate the maximum number of parallel processes handled by the Mail Gateway.
API timeout (seconds): Define the maximum waiting time for obtaining a valid score from the remote cache.
Email detained timeout (seconds): This field indicates the maximum waiting time for obtaining a valid score from the remote cache. After this time the file will be passed.

Quarantine timeout (days): Configure the days that have to pass since a file identified as Malware is blocked and retained until an action is defined to manage it. If no action is performed or the indicated time is exceeded, the file is discarded.
Cache Sync (hours) (minutes): Indicate the maximum time that must pass for the synchronization of the local and remote cache. Value in hours and minutes.
Maximum number of stored log files: Delimit the maximum time that the file will remain stored in the email history.

note.title: Note
note.para: The score obtained by consulting the remote cache is the average of the results obtained after consulting various external sources such as Virustotal or Metadefender.
The valid values for the score are the following:
Malware: any value equal to or greater than that defined by the user.

section.title: Blacklist
section.para: In this section the user can create a list of those files (Hash), URLs or IPs that are considered reliable, and therefore should not be blocked.
To indicate the type of object to be blocked, it is necessary to select the corresponding tab and enter the value of the file, IP or URL using the option + Add (Hash, URL, IP).

Once this information has been inserted, when selecting the option Add to blacklist, ethe new object will be added to the list of blocked objects: Blacklisted Hashes, Blacklisted URLs or Blacklisted IPs.
Search: The user can use the finder to quickly locate a locked object.
Download CSV: Download the list of blocked objects in .csv format.

para.emphasis: Exclude an object from a blacklist and include it in a whitelist

section.para: It is possible that after its analysis the user considers that a certain object should not be blocked and its access to the network should be allowed in all cases. To do this, simply hover the mouse over said object and when clicking select the Move to whitelist. option. You can also remove that object from the list using the Remove option that appears in the same submenu.

section.title: Whitelist
section.para: In this section the user can create a list of those files (Hash), URLs or IPs that must be automatically blocked by the platform.
To indicate the type of object to be added to the whitelist, select the corresponding tab and enter the value of the file, IP or URL using the option + Add (Hash, URL, IP).
Once this information has been inserted, selecting the Add to whitelist option will add the new object to the list of blocked objects: Whitelisted Hashes, Whitelisted URLs or Whitelisted IPs.
Search: The user can use the finder to quickly locate a locked object.
Download CSV: Download the list of blocked objects in .csv format.

para.emphasis: Exclude an object from a whitelist and include it in a blacklist

section.para: It is possible that after its analysis, the user considers that a certain object should be blocked and prevent its access to the network in all cases. To do this, simply hover the mouse over said object and select the Move to blacklist.You can also remove that object from the list using the Remove option that appears in the same submenu.

section.title: Licenses
section.para: Through this option the user can check which nodes have their liceses expired. In the same, it is possible to upload a new license or request for a new one.

On the top edge of the screen there are indicated the number of available licenses, the Apps that can be used under these licenses and the number of expired nodes. There is a list of expired nodes which need to renew their licenses at the center of screen. There is also a list of the available actions.
To upload a file with a new redBorder license, click on Select file. To request a new license click on Request a license.

caption.para: Licenses: queries and updating of expired licenses

section.title: Lookup Sources
section.para: List of the web services URLs which perform the network data queries. From this screen it is possible to add more web services, as well as edit the existing ones.
Delete a service: click on "Delete" button.
Edit an existing service: click on "Edit" button:
Add new web service: click on the button +Add Lookup Source.

section.title: Objets
section.para: The option Objects allows the direct creation and edition of Objects. The user can navigate through different tabs that corresponding to the types of objects that can be created. If you want to locate the objects in a more efficiently way you can use the browser.
Three kind of objects can be created:

listitem.para: Net
MAC
VLAN

section.para: Create a new object: click on New (Net, MAC, VLAN) Object
Edit an existing object: click on "Edit" button.
Delete an object: click on the "Delete" icon.

caption.para: Objects: create a new net object

section.para: In all cases when you are creating or editing an object, the system asks you for a name, a value for it and description.
In the top right margin an options submenu is shown. It allows user to import or export the data concerning these objects in .csv format.

note.title: Note
note.para: It is possible to create an object directly from the attributes that are shown in the tables, as in Flow App as IPS. For this, click the inverted narrow that appears when we pass the mouse over an attribute like IP, MAC or VLAN.

section.title: Overlay Maps
section.para: This option allows to overlay an image over a Google map in order to get more customization.
Edit Map: click on the "Edit" button positioned next to the existing maps list.
Add new map: click on +New Overlay Map.
In both cases, it will be indicated the name of the map, latitude and longitud in where the image should be located.
Por último, subir la imagen desde su equipo en formato .jpg o .png.

caption.para: Overlay Map: overlay images over a world map

section.title: Platform Alerts
section.para: Here the user can see the alerts from the platform. All the alerts are shown to every user.
There are three levels for the alerts: info, warning and danger. Each level has its own colour so the alerts can be differenced.
Is possible to create alerts for the platform using the New Alert button. Is necessary to select the alert level, and the message of the alert.
If the alert message is clicked by the user, it won't be shown again until the user logs in again.
Is possible to remove the alert by clicking on the cross in the message. After that the alert message won't be shown anymore.

section.title: Rule Versions
section.para: The user can manage the sources for the rules of the platform. It is possible to add or upload new sources and also enable the chosen ones. The rules are used for Snort probe, which is used by traffic module.
It is possible to upload rules for a particular IPS using the option Upload Source, where the user can select the file to upload.

It is also possible to add sources for downloading new rules from the internet that are updated periodically. If it is necessary the user can use the Force Rule Update to be sure that all the rules are updated.

section.title: Support Center
section.para: The user can use the Support Center in order to solve any question or problem regarding the platform. It is necessary to be registered in the Support Center.

section.title: Users
section.para: The activation or modification of users' data, services management or the creation of new registers is possible from the Users settings interface.
To search a specific user, introduce their data in the browser. You can also navigate through the alphabetic list that is located on top of users list.

The only user that has permissions to do that is Superadministrator. The rest of the users can only visualize the sections of the platform (reading mode) but not modify its content (except in the case of its own user profile).

In the body of the screen we find a list that contains the active users in redBorder platform, email address, Top Domain (maximun level that the user has access), number of times that they have signed in, IP and hour from which they made their last access.
Clicking on the "Edit" button the user can modify the following information and visualize a summary of their state and activity within the platform:

important.title: Important
important.para: Every time that any data in a user's profile is modified, the current password should be introduced to confirm the changes.

section.para: Active a new user: to create a new user click on +New User. Complete the information required in the user's profile. Active Administrator check to obtain full permissions.

section.title: Worker and job queue
section.para: In this option the user can check the status of work (Worker) and services (Job) that are running in the background. You can also check which of these tasks have been completed.

note.title: Note
note.para: We call Worker programs that are steadily running in the background.
A Job is a program that runs periodically or only once, but it does not stay running in the background, but runs and closes.

caption.para: ¡Worker and Job Queue: status list of worker and job queue.

section.para: Stored Jobs shows the list of finished services. You can know the status of each one through the “Information” icon, or delete from the list using the “Delete” icon.
This screen automatically reloads every 5 seconds.

caption.para: Worker and Job Queue: information of the state of a work

section.title: User area
section.para: At the top right of the menu bar you find the user area, from which you can view notifications, check the profile, access context-sensitive help and exit the system.

To view a summary list of notifications simply click on User's area. To access a complete list of them, select the option View All or click on any of the notifications that appear in the summary; in this way you can access a new screen from which you can view the details of notifications, and remove all of them through the option Delete All.
This option allows direct access to the user profile and perform the same actions with the option Tools>Users.
This option enables a context-sensitive help that facilitates navigation and usability of the platform.
For safe disconnection of the platform, select the option Logout. The system will return to the login screen.

caption.para: User area: login screen after Logout
